ygData.subject: Re: RE: OT: Druids
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I guess that s where our difference lies then.  I don t consider it a problem if the time it takes to do this is approximately the same as the experience
ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 5 Aug 1999, Wayne Sheppard wrote:
> >
> > I still don't understand why people equate "solo reds" with
> > overpowered.
>
> If one class can easily "solo reds" with relative saftey without taking one
> point of damage, throughout a majority of their levels, then I would
> consider them overpowered.

I guess that's where our difference lies then. I don't
consider it a problem if the time it takes to do this is
approximately the same as the experience gained from fighting
blues solo in the same time (which in my experience it has
been on average). Like I said, to me power is a
multi-dimensional measure, and being extraordinarily good at
one thing (kiting) can easily be offset by being not-so-good
at one other thing (many in the case of a druid). If you want
to measure it by one variable, then we're never going to
agree.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
